lines.content: * A type of Task that has a end time denoted by /by in the user input.
* @param by String for the time of Deadline
* @param isDone indicates if Deadline has been completed
* @param hasNotif indicates if a notif needs to be sent to user for the creation of this Deadline
public Deadline(String description, String by, boolean isDone, boolean hasNotif) {
* @param byDate LocalDate for the time of Deadline
* @param isDone indicates if Deadline has been completed
* @param hasNotif indicates if a notif needs to be sent to user for the creation of this Deadline
public Deadline(String description, LocalDate byDate, boolean isDone, boolean hasNotif) {
* Represents a chatbot that can be run with functionality of a to-do list keeper.
* Each Duke object has a Storage to load and save a .txt list,
* TaskList for storing the Tasks, and a Ui for interacting
* @param filePath String of the filepath of the list from source folder.
* Runs the duke chatbot by loading the TaskList and calling the Ui and Parser
* A class of exceptions that are thrown for invalid user inputs when parsed.
* A class of DukeException thrown when the index for Task number is not found within the
return "Sorry, this task number cannot be found :(";
* A class of DukeException thrown when an invalid Task number is provided.
return "Sorry, I am not sure what the task number is :(";
* A class of DukeException thrown when an invalid description is provided.
return "Oops :( Please key in a valid description!";
* A class of DukeException thrown when no time for a Deadline or
return "Oops :( Please key in a valid time to proceed";
* A class of DukeException thrown when an invalid input is provided and
return "Oops :( Friend does not recognise this command! "
return "Oops :( Please key in a valid search to proceed!";
* A type of Task that has a start and end time denoted by /at in the user input.
* @param at String for the time of Event
* @param isDone indicates if Event has been completed
* @param hasNotif indicates if a notif needs to be sent to user for the creation of this Event
public Event(String description, String at, boolean isDone, boolean hasNotif) {
* @param atDate LocalDate for the time of Event
* @param isDone indicates if Event has been completed
* @param hasNotif indicates if a notif needs to be sent to user for the creation of this Event
public Event(String description, LocalDate atDate, boolean isDone, boolean hasNotif) {
* Represents a parser that process the user's input and handles with appropriate action.
* @param duke the Duke object that is the parent.
* Checks if a String is a valid LocalDate of correct yyyy-MM-dd form.
* @return true if String is valid date.
* Handles the input that is received by the Ui and performs the corresponding action
* @param message String command that is received from the Scanner in Ui.
* Represents a storage space that loads the list.txt of existing tasks and saves new
* @param filePath String of the filepath of the list from source folder.
* @param duke the Duke object that is the parent.
* Loads the existing Tasks from the TaskList when Duke is ran.
File f = new File(filePath); // create a File for the given file path
Scanner s = new Scanner(f); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
* Saves the new Tasks from the TaskList after changes are made to the TaskList.
* @param isDone indicates if Task has been completed
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Represents a list that keeps track of the Tasks that the user has.
* @param duke the Duke object that is the parent.
* Prints the TaskList in the correct format to be displayed in Ui.
* @return String of the current TaskList that has been formatted properly.
* @param time        of the Task if it is a Deadline or Event.
* @param category in the Task.CATEGORY enumeration. Either ToDo, Deadline or Event.
* @param isDone boolean indicating if Task has been completed yet.
* @param hasNotif boolean indicating if Task addition should be printed to Ui.
public void createTask(String description, String time, Task.Category category,
* Adds a Task to the TaskList with a date in LocalDate format.
* @param time        of the Task if it is a Deadline or Event, in LocalDate.
* @param category in the Task.CATEGORY enumeration. Either ToDo, Deadline or Event.
* @param isDone boolean indicating if Task has been completed yet.
* @param hasNotif boolean indicating if Task addition should be printed to Ui.
public void createTaskDate(String description, LocalDate time, Task.Category category,
* A type of Task that has a description attached to it.
* @param isDone indicates if ToDo has been completed
* @param hasNotif indicates if a notif needs to be sent to user for the creation of this Todo.
public ToDo(String description, boolean isDone, boolean hasNotif) {
* Represents the interface that interacts with the user, receiving commands from the user and
* responding to the user directly through the console.
protected static final String FRIENDGREETING = "(*^_^*) Friend says: \n";
* @param duke the Duke object that is the parent.
System.out.println("Hi there! Start chatting with your new \n" + LOGO);
System.out.println(FRIENDGREETING + "What would you like to do today?");
System.out.println(FRIENDGREETING + "Your to-do list has the following tasks: \n");
System.out.println(FRIENDGREETING + "removed the following task from your to-do list: \n" + removed);
System.out.println("Now you have " + duke.getTasks().getList().size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Now you have " + listSize + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(FRIENDGREETING + description + " has already been done! :)");
System.out.println(FRIENDGREETING + "Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println(FRIENDGREETING + "There are no tasks that match your search.");
* A class to test the methods in Deadline.
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("description", "tomorrow", false, false);
